dialogues.text: Yeah, Socrates. This guy, he stops people in the street and he asks them: "Are you sure of thinking what you think? Are you sure of doing what you do?" And so on. After that, people start getting confused. They ask questions. The guy's too much.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: What does he ask people about?

dialogues.speaker: ESMERALDA
dialogues.text: Everything. Love, religion, God, people, everything.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: It's good you read it.

dialogues.speaker: ESMERALDA
dialogues.text: I know. She hesitates, then adopts a mischievous tone.

dialogues.speaker: ESMERALDA
dialogues.text: It's not a skank's book! This remark elicits laughter from the students who were starting to get bored with this discussion about Socrates. There’s an air of reconciliation in the air. The ringing of the bell creates a mood of general euphoria that Frangois calms down.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: Wait a second! Before you leave, here are your self-portraits. One by one. When you have yours, you can go. Each one of you in turn.  113. As an end-of-year gift, he hands out the book of self- portraits that he has had bound. The students are over the moon as they look for their own texts. A moment of intense pride. Khoumba leafs through the pages of Souleymane’s photos in silence.

dialogues.speaker: KHOUMBA
dialogues.text: Sir, this is really kind of you.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: These are the self-portraits that you wrote and that we made up with the class photo and so on. (to a student) You don't have yours?

dialogues.speaker: NASSIM
dialogues.text: Sir, seriously, why did you put this here?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: You look good in it.

dialogues.speaker: NASSIM
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: You're like a leader. Have a good vacation.

dialogues.speaker: NASSIM
dialogues.text: Thank you. You too. The students hurry out. For the first time, Henriette dares to approach her teacher.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: Sir? Frangois looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: Yes? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: I didn't learn anything.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: What? Why are you saying that? That doesn't mean anything.  114. The girl is edgy, on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: Earlier, all the others said they'd learned something. Compared to them, I learned nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: Come on, you learned as much as them. They had to think hard too. It's not easy to remember what you learned off the top of your head like that.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: But I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: I don't understand what we do.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: In French?

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: In everything.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: You can't say you don't understand anything in any subject. That's not true, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: I don't want to go to vocational school.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: There's no question of that yet. You're moving on to the next year. You'll have plenty of time to think about your future. Vocational school isn't an absolute certainty. It all depends on how you do next year. With what she hopes is a discreet gesture, she dries her tears.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIETTE
dialogues.text: But I don't want to. She goes out, leaving Frangois alone and a little sad.  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the yard, we find the students, teachers and members of the administrative staff caught up in a soccer match. The adolescents are virtually hysterical at the idea of tackling their teachers.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: (shouting during the game) Go! All together! All together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final shot shows the empty classroom, then fades to black.
